response_parsed.title: Observing Event-Driven Systems with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to implement an event-driven system using FastAPI in Python 3.12+, focusing on real-time data streaming and websockets for efficient communication between clients and servers.
key_points: Installation of required packages: FastAPI, Uvicorn, websockets
Creating a FastAPI application with basic endpoint definitions
Implementing WebSocket support to handle real-time data streaming
Setting up event-driven architecture for handling multiple clients concurrently
Testing the FastAPI web application using appropriate tools

code_examples.code:
async def websocket_endpoint(websocket: WebSocket):
    await websocket.accept()
    while True:
        data = await websocket.receive_text()
        # Process incoming event data here

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for using FastAPI's improved support for async/await
Uvicorn version 0.17.6 or later is recommended for running the FastAPI application
caveats: FastAPI has limitations in handling long-polling requests, which may affect some event-driven use cases
Ensure proper error handling and graceful degradation for client disconnections or other potential issues
